Package edu.rit.gpu

Package edu.rit.gpu contains classes for Parallel Java 2's graphics processing unit (GPU) programming capability.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Kernel
    Interface Kernel specifies the base interface for a GPU kernel function.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Gpu
    Class Gpu encapsulates a graphics processing unit (GPU) compute device.
    GpuArray
    Class GpuArray is the abstract base class for a GPU array variable.
    GpuByteArray
    Class GpuByteArray provides a byte array GPU variable.
    GpuByteMatrix
    Class GpuByteMatrix provides a byte matrix GPU variable.
    GpuByteVbl
    Class GpuByteVbl provides a byte GPU variable.
    GpuDoubleArray
    Class GpuDoubleArray provides a double array GPU variable.
    GpuDoubleMatrix
    Class GpuDoubleMatrix provides a double matrix GPU variable.
    GpuDoubleVbl
    Class GpuDoubleVbl provides a double GPU variable.
    GpuFloatArray
    Class GpuFloatArray provides a float array GPU variable.
    GpuFloatMatrix
    Class GpuFloatMatrix provides a float matrix GPU variable.
    GpuFloatVbl
    Class GpuFloatVbl provides a float GPU variable.
    GpuIntArray
    Class GpuIntArray provides an integer array GPU variable.
    GpuIntMatrix
    Class GpuIntMatrix provides an integer matrix GPU variable.
    GpuIntVbl
    Class GpuIntVbl provides an integer GPU variable.
    GpuLongArray
    Class GpuLongArray provides a long integer array GPU variable.
    GpuLongMatrix
    Class GpuLongMatrix provides a long integer matrix GPU variable.
    GpuLongVbl
    Class GpuLongVbl provides a long integer GPU variable.
    GpuMatrix
    Class GpuMatrix is the abstract base class for a GPU matrix variable.
    GpuShortArray
    Class GpuShortArray provides a short integer array GPU variable.
    GpuShortMatrix
    Class GpuShortMatrix provides a short integer matrix GPU variable.
    GpuShortVbl
    Class GpuShortVbl provides a short integer GPU variable.
    GpuStructArray<T extends Struct>
    Class GpuStructArray provides a struct array GPU variable.
    GpuStructVbl<T extends Struct>
    Class GpuStructVbl provides a struct GPU variable.
    GpuVbl
    Class GpuVbl is the abstract base class for a GPU variable.
    Module
    Class Module encapsulates a module that contains GPU kernel functions and data.
    Struct
    Class Struct is the abstract base class for a Java object on the CPU that is converted to or from a C struct on the GPU.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    CacheConfig
    Enum CacheConfig enumerates GPU cache configurations.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CudaException
    Class CudaException is the base class for an exception thrown if a CUDA error occurred.
    DeinitializedCudaException
    Class DeinitializedCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_DEINITIALIZED error occurred.
    FileNotFoundCudaException
    Class FileNotFoundCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND error occurred.
    GpuException
    Class GpuException is the base class for an exception thrown if a GPU error occurred.
    GpuNotSupportedException
    Class GpuNotSupportedException is thrown if GPU parallel programs are not supported.
    InvalidContextCudaException
    Class InvalidContextCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_INVALID_CONTEXT error occurred.

    Class InvalidDeviceCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_INVALID_DEVICE error occurred.
    InvalidHandleCudaException
    Class InvalidHandleCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_INVALID_HANDLE error occurred.
    InvalidImageCudaException
    Class InvalidImageCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_INVALID_IMAGE error occurred.
    InvalidValueCudaException
    Class InvalidValueCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE error occurred.
    LaunchFailedCudaException
    Class LaunchFailedCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_LAUNCH_FAILED error occurred.
    LaunchIncompatibleTexturingCudaException
    Class LaunchIncompatibleTexturingCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_LAUNCH_INCOMPATIBLE_TEXTURING error occurred.
    LaunchOutOfResourcesCudaException
    Class LaunchOutOfResourcesCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_LAUNCH_OUT_OF_RESOURCES error occurred.
    LaunchTimeoutCudaException
    Class LaunchTimeoutCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_LAUNCH_TIMEOUT error occurred.
    NotFoundCudaException
    Class NotFoundCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_NOT_FOUND error occurred.
    NotInitializedCudaException
    Class NotInitializedCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_NOT_INITIALIZED error occurred.
    OutOfMemoryCudaException
    Class OutOfMemoryCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY error occurred.
    SharedObjectInitFailedCudaException
    Class SharedObjectInitFailedCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_SHARED_OBJECT_INIT_FAILED error occurred.
    SharedObjectSymbolNotFoundCudaException
    Class SharedObjectSymbolNotFoundCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_SHARED_OBJECT_SYMBOL_NOT_FOUND error occurred.
    UnknownCudaException
    Class UnknownCudaException is thrown if a CUDA_ERROR_UNKNOWN error occurred.

Package edu.rit.gpu Description

Package edu.rit.gpu contains classes for Parallel Java 2's graphics processing unit (GPU) programming capability. At present the package supports GPU kernels written using Nvidia Corporation's CUDA version 5.0.

A PJ2 GPU program's main program is written in Java using PJ2. The GPU kernels are written in C or C++ using CUDA. Classes in package edu.rit.gpu let the main program transfer data between the CPU's memory and the GPU's memory, execute kernel functions on the GPU, and do other GPU related operations.

Installation
Usage
Writing PJ2 GPU Programs

Installation

Do the following steps to install PJ2's GPU capability. These steps are not needed if PJ2's GPU capability is not needed. Some familiarity with the Java Native Interface (JNI) would be helpful; see Sheng Liang, Java Native Interface: Programmer's Guide and Specification (Addison-Wesley, 1999).

  1. Install CUDA.

  2. Install the PJ2 source distribution as described in the Overview.

  3. Change to the lib/ directory in the source distribution and run the ccompile shell script. On a Linux system, this compiles the edu_rit_gpu_Cuda.c source file and creates the libEduRitGpuCuda.so native code library file. You might need to modify the shell script to create the proper native code library file for your system.

  4. Move the native code library file to a directory on the load library path, where the Java Virtual Machine can find it. See "Usage" below.

  5. Change to the lib/edu/rit/gpu/example/ directory in the source distribution and run the ccompile shell script. This compiles the CUDA module files needed by the Java classes in package edu.rit.gpu.example. You might need to modify the shell script for your system.

  6. Change to the lib/edu/rit/gpu/test/ directory and run the ccompile shell script. This compiles the CUDA module files needed by the Java classes in package edu.rit.gpu.test. You might need to modify the shell script for your system.

  7. If you are installing the PJ2 executable distribution as described in the Overview, the compiled CUDA module files must be added to the PJ2 JAR file. Change to the lib/ directory in the source distribution and run this command:
        jar uf <jarfile> edu/rit/gpu/*/*.cubin edu/rit/gpu/*/*.ptx
    replacing <jarfile> with the pathname of the PJ2 JAR file.

Usage

When compiling and executing Java programs that use PJ2's GPU capability, in addition to setting the Java class path as described in the Overview, you must also set your load library path to include the directory where the PJ2 native code library file resides. Here is an example of a command for the bash shell to add an appropriate directory to the front of the load library path:

export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/var/tmp/parajava/pj2:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH

Here is an example of a command for the csh shell to add an appropriate directory to the front of the load library path:

setenv LD_LIBRARY_PATH /var/tmp/parajava/pj2:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH

Writing PJ2 GPU Programs

Use class Gpu to configure GPU devices, load compiled GPU module files, and set up dynamically allocated variables in GPU memory.

Use class Module to get statically allocated GPU variables and GPU kernel functions from a compiled GPU module.

Use interface Kernel to configure and execute GPU kernel functions.

For further information, study and run the example programs in package edu.rit.gpu.example.
